body.name: LIVIKEY Smart Watch, Fitness Tracker with Heart Rate Monitor, Blood Oxygen, Sleep Tracking, 41mm Smartwatch 5ATM Waterproof with Pedometer for Women Men Compatible with Android iPhone iOS
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 6 hrs 51 mins
features: Heart Rate Monitoring and SpO2: Our smart watch monitors your heart rate in real time, and you can use the watch to manually detect your SpO2. Our smartwatch will also automatically track your sleep, record light sleep, deep sleep, and awake time, and analyze your sleep quality to help you build a healthier lifestyle.

14 Sports Modes and Accurate Health Tracker: Our Fitness Watch supports 14 sports modes, like walking, running, cycling and so on. You can keep track of your workout throughout the day, including your steps, distance, calories burned, and mileage. You can connect your smartphone GPS to your smart watch to track all your routes and distances during your workout.

5ATM Waterproof and 7 Days Battery Life: Our fitness smartwatch is designed with 5ATM water resistance rating, which can resist any sweat and rain of your daily activities, and can even be worn while swimming. After fully charged, you can enjoy up to 7 days use time, or up to 30 days standby time.

Call and Message Notification: Incoming call and SMS reminders ensure that you will not miss any important things. You can customize message notifications for certain specific applications like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, Text Messages etc, to avoid excessive message interruption.

Customize Your Watch Style and Wide Compatibility: The 41mm (1.3" ) screen smartwatch provides various dials to choose from, or you can customize the watch face with your own photos. It also features with many practical tools like pedometer, breath training, music control, alarm clock, stopwatch, adjustable brightness, calendar, time display etc. Compatible with Android OS 5.0 & iOS 10.0 & Bluetooth 4.0 or above.
Gentle reminders: Please do not wear the smart watch too tightly to prevent excessive friction that may cause skin abrasion. Give your watch a break after prolonged use.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Heart Rate Monitoring The advanced HR sensor can accurately and effectively monitor your heart rate 24 hours a day, helping you have a healthier life. Sleep Quality Monitoring Accurately track and analyze your sleep time and quality, record light sleep, deep sleep, and awake time, and view your sleep data for the day directly on the smart watch. SpO2 Saturation SpO2 monitoring helps you understand the body’s ability to absorb oxygen and the amount of oxygen delivered to the body. Note: When using, please place your wrist flat on a table or other surface to get more accurate results, and the data is for reference only and cannot be used for medical purposes.

5ATM Waterproof Fitness Watch The smartwatch is designed with a 5ATM waterproof rating, and its water-resistant up to 50 meters, making it not only resistant to daily hand washing, sweating and exercising in rainy day, but also suitable for water sports such as swimming. Smart Reminders on Wrist The smart watches for women and men can receive message notifications from smartphones, which helps you stay up-to-date and avoid missing important information. (The watch can not make calls or text back). Music Control Use the smart watch to easily control music and switch songs without taking the phone out of your pocket, allowing you to play/pause, skip songs and change the volume when the watch is synchronized with the smart phone.

Stress Level Measurement Take case of your health by monitoring stress levels and taking proactive steps to manage stress effectively. Long Lasting Battery Life The Step Calories Tracker will take 2 hours to charge and last for up to 7 days of continuous use or 30 days standby time. The ultra-lightweight USB cable can be carried out easily and conveniently. With More Practical Features The smart watch compatible android ios features practical tools such as stopwatch, timer, music control, breath training, night mode, alarm clock, wrist wake-up, sedentary reminder and drinking reminder, providing more convenience and enjoyment to your daily life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The LIVIKEY Smart Watch is a perfect choice.
reviews.reviewText: The LIVIKEY Smart Phone is cheap but has high quality. It looks good and has several colors to choose. It matches both men and women. When wearing it, it can track my blood oxygen, steps and monitor my heart rate, even it is waterproof. So it is multifunctional and is really a good tracker for my health. I think if you buy it for yourself or as a gift, it is a perfect choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great smart watch and worth every penny
reviews.reviewText: Excellent product for the price. It was super easy to set up and I was able to easily install the fit dock app on my iPhone. It does alert you to incoming calls and texts but you cannot respond using watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good price, decent tracking, bad for sleep tracking
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Video comment: the screen works well to touchon your wrist. The beginning of the video I only struggled because it was on a table.Overall though for the price you pay this is an excellent watch. It has all the functions of a Fitbit even if all of them aren't the best. It's a million times cheaper than a Fitbit though, so it's great if like me, you don't like that higher price tag commitment.a couple of cons I have noticed:1. The sleep tracker is wholey inaccurate. I think it just cycles the light and sleep back and forth. It doesn't register your waking, it says I never wake up when I very much wake up to turn off my husband's 9 alarms every morning.2. The heart rate monitor doesn't seem to cycle super often, I will feel my HR high and it will say I'm at 80, I'll manually force it and it will jump up. It does well when you schedule a workout though.3. The app could definitely use some finagling as some of it seems hard to interpret but overall does what it is meant to.4. The connection goes in and out so the find your phone feature only works... Sometimes.All this to say if that's the worst part about it.. this watch is pretty awesome. As long as those two items aren't something you're trying really hard to keep an eye on them this will get you good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for me
reviews.reviewText: Cute little smart watch. Does what I need, time, steps, heart rate, oxygen level, alert me for a phone call or text message and probably more stuff fhat is beyond my knowledge. For the price, it’s great. Only issue is that the battery does not hold up as long as advertised. I tend to charge it no longer than two days apart. I didn’t take any stars off for that as it’s not as issue for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good Battery Life
reviews.reviewText: Stays charge for a long time and charges quickly. The pink color is cute and the band is sturdy. You have to get the app to set things up on it which I didn’t mind. Can be difficult to work at times. Great for exercise and you can see text and email’s but not much else. Good price though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Die hard battery life
reviews.reviewText: I usually hate leaving reviews for anything, but this one warranted a five-star review, so I had to leave one. All I can say is that this thing still has not needed to be recharged and I've had it going on 10 days already and it's still at 64% charged. It is super easy to use, and I'm not a techy genius by any stretch of the imagination. Simple Bluetooth connection to my iPhone to read and compare data on an app (free) that I downloaded for that purpose. It tracks calories burned, steps taken, distance walked and daily activity times, continuous heart rate monitoring option, hours slept (deep sleep, light sleep, and awake times), blood oxygen levels, option to remind me to drink water every hour (or up to every 4 hours), tracks my phone so I can hear it ring when I misplace it, option to remind me to move my butt every hour (or up to every 4 hours), optional heart rate warning, take photo with my phone by shaking the watch, personalize with pretty much any photo and a variety of pre-loaded watch faces through the app, receive texts (cannot reply), vibrates when my phone rings (cannot answer phone through watch), AND it is completely waterproof. I showered with it a few times and I've had no issues with it getting wet. The only thing that I would change if I could would be adding the weather app, but with all the functionality it currently has, I'm not complaining. I don't check the weather often anyway, but it still would be nice to have that feature.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. My hubby and I were spending too much on fitness watches and they only worked for a year or two until the watch's phone software was updated so that the watch was considered too old (too low tech) for the software. So we bought plain Timex watches last year. The Timex watches were simple and lasted a little longer, but we missed the fitness watch bells and whistles. So, onto this watch. Very reasonably priced with all the features of a fitbit. What a great watch this is, with all the nice features we like! The personalized watch dial faces are really nice. The step counter seems accurate. The sleep record is even pretty good. And for the price, it's remarkable. I don't know how long the watch will last, and I wish the battery power lasted longer, but at just over $20, this was a really great purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very useful watch
reviews.reviewText: This product is good for when I do my workouts because I can track the calories I burn and I can also track my steps and heart rate what is also cool is that you can track your stress levels and it also has an app called breath training where it tells you to inhale and exhale and it is actually surprisingly relaxing it can also track how much sleep you got and if you connect it to your phone or device, you can play your music and there's also a stopwatch which is very helpful a lot of times and there is also a flashlight, which is awesome and as I said, but again, if you connect it to your phone device, then you can click this app called find phone and it'll ping your phone for you. and it can also track the weather but in conclusion, it is a really good watch, and I would totally recommend 4/5 also killer battery life
